reviewText: This was a great movie, I've always liked Glen Ford in westerns. I liked the scenery and I liked the bulls I guess because I've always liked watching bull riding. This movie is worth having.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Even if a film is not the greatest, Glenn Ford makes it better than mediocre.  Please do not compare this film with the slam bam sparkle blitz of today's films.  When this flick was made, they had to rely on real actors.  Glenn Ford is a real actor who uses body language, gestures, facial expressions, moments of quietness, and yes, words which are clearly understandable.  This was a good film and it's well worth watching.  Enjoy.
Title: N/A

reviewText: If you want to know the synopsis of this charming movie, just check the other reviews of other commentators.  I just would like to say that finally , a Region 1 (USA compatible)) DVD has been released by Olive Films and is quite a good video transfer.  The DVD only has Play and scene selections as features.  Had been waiting for this Glenn Ford movie for a long time to be released on a Region 1 DVD.
summary: Very Nice Transfer of a Long Awaited movie

reviewText: Glenn Ford does his patented understated hero again, this time as a Texas cowboy delivering prize Brahma bulls in Brazil where he runs afoul of bad guy Frank Lovejoy. But it is Cesar Romero, an actor who once played the Cisco Kid, who steals the show as an aging and comical bandit -- much as we might believe the real Cisco would have become in his later years. Cult director William Castle, of all people, helmed this RKO film and did an OK job.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Olive Films finally went cheap and has started using the cheap recyclable Blu-ray cases that do nothing to protect the disc inside nor the artwork on the outside cover.  Criterion is still the best when it comes to providing top quality cases for their movies.
